alert.note: Alert for Kewaunee; Manitowoc (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 1:18PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Kewaunee and eastern Manitowoc Counties through 200 PM CDT... At 118 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Two Creeks, or 13 miles north of Manitowoc, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Manitowoc, Cleveland, Two Creeks, Two Rivers, Newton, Mishicot, Larrabee, Francis Creek, Clover and Pilsen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
